localizedDescriptions.de: Document to communicate information to others about the result of a test or assessment.
Identification information about the report.
The status of the entire report. Note: This is not the status of any of the report components.
Details about use of all forms of alcohol at a specified point in time or over a specified period of time.
An unspecified event.
Details about the consumption of specific forms of alcohol.
Form of alcohol consumed.

annotations.comment: Coding of the form of alcohol with a terminology is desirable, where possible.

localizedDescriptions.de: Amount of alcohol consumed.
Number of standard drinks of alcohol consumed.

annotations.comment: Optional definition of a standard drink is available in the Protocol, as this varies internationally.

localizedDescriptions.de: Grams of alcohol consumed.

annotations.comment: Only one option allowed - either number or standard drinks or weight consumed - per form of alcohol.

localizedDescriptions.de: Identified triggers which stimulate or cause consumption of this form of alcohol.

annotations.comment: For example, relationship issues or work stress.

localizedDescriptions.de: Description about the social or cultural context that contributed to the consumption of this form of alcohol.

annotations.comment: For example, when at a party or with a meal.

localizedDescriptions.de: Narrative description of any  behavioural issues that may indicate  alcohol abuse or dependence.

annotations.comment: For example: binge drinking; neglecting responsibilities; legal problems or relationship issues related to drinking behaviour; drinking in inappropriate or dangerous situations; or needing a drink in the morning to steady 'the nerves'.

localizedDescriptions.de: Additional narrative about the alcohol consumption not captured in other fields.
Actual alcohol consumption on a specified day. Supports recording consumption in a Alcohol Diary.
Details about the consumption of specific forms of alcohol.
Form of alcohol consumed.

annotations.comment: Coding of the form of alcohol with a terminology is desirable, where possible.

localizedDescriptions.de: Amount of alcohol consumed.
Number of standard drinks of alcohol consumed.

annotations.comment: Optional definition of a standard drink is available in the Protocol, as this varies internationally.

localizedDescriptions.de: Grams of alcohol consumed.

annotations.comment: Only one option allowed - either number or standard drinks or weight consumed - per form of alcohol.

localizedDescriptions.de: Identified triggers which stimulate or cause consumption of this form of alcohol.

annotations.comment: For example, relationship issues or work stress.

localizedDescriptions.de: Description about the social or cultural context that contributed to the consumption of this form of alcohol.

annotations.comment: For example, when at a party or with a meal.

localizedDescriptions.de: Narrative description of any  behavioural issues that may indicate  alcohol abuse or dependence.

annotations.comment: For example: binge drinking; neglecting responsibilities; legal problems or relationship issues related to drinking behaviour; drinking in inappropriate or dangerous situations; or needing a drink in the morning to steady 'the nerves'.

localizedDescriptions.de: Additional narrative about the alcohol consumption not captured in other fields.
Amount of alcohol defining a standard drink.
Frequency of 'Average Use' per time interval.

annotations.comment: Typical use: to support the assessment of binge drinking. This is done by recording the typical consumption of alcohol per day using the 'Standard Drinks' data element within the 'Average Use Interval' event - for example, 8 standard drinks per day. Additional use of this 'Average Use Frequency' data element allows recording of the number of days per time interval that the patient is consuming, for example an average of 8 standard drinks on 3 days/week.
